description.narrative: The project development objectives are to assist in the implementation of the Governmentâ€™s national HIV/AIDS program through support to: (i) deepening of prevention interventions targeted at high risk groups and for the general population (ii) increasing of access to treatment, care and support services for infected and affected individuals; (iii) strengthening of program management and analysis to identify priorities for strengthening the health sector capacity to respond to the HIV/AIDS epidemic and other priority health problems.

condition.narrative: The Borrower shall furnish the audited Financial Statements for each financial year to the Bank not later than four months afterthe end of such period.
The Borrower shall furnish to the Bank, not later than forty five (45) days after the end of each calendar quarter, interimunaudited financial reports satisfactory to the Bank.
The Borrower shall prepare consolidated annual work plans for the Project not later than February 28 of each year during Projectimplementation.
The Government shall maintain a Project coordinating unit, within the NHP of the MOH acceptable to the Bank.

title.narrative: % of SW who received HIV testing in the last 12 months and who know the results.

comment.narrative: Component 1 indicator.

Target Surpassed. The original target has been achieved and surpassed, however, the target that was revised upwards has not beenachieved. The target was revised upward from 50% to 80% in line with previously established National and Global Fund target.

title.narrative: % of MSM reporting the use of condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner

comment.narrative: Component 1 indicator.

Target Not Achieved. Among the contributing factors for the target not having been achieved are that the strategy to reach MSM isrelatively new and operates in a highly stigmatized environment and is has been challenging to secure buy-in and support from CSOpartners into a consolidated response. Final report on MSM survey will be available by June 30, 2012 (to be confirmed).

title.narrative: % of SW reporting condom use with their most recent client.

comment.narrative: Component 1 indicator.

Target achieved. Since the target had been surpassed since 2008 the team proposed a rewording of the indicator to capturebehaviorpatterns with regular paying partners, where condom use is lower, and new paying partners. The target under the rewordedindicator(5b in Aide Memoire reflected here as sub-indicator) has not been achieved.

title.narrative: % of inmates reached through prevention activities

comment.narrative: Component 1 indicator.

Targets have been increased as a significant amount of funds have been approved or re-programmed to further increase BCC outreachwork. The revised targets are in line with increased national targets also approved by the Global Fund. The target has beenincreased from 15% to 18% or 900 per year.

Target Surpassed. Both original target and target that was revised upwards have been achieved and surpassed. Factorscontributingto the target being surpassed are that there is a policy in place to test all inmates once they enter the correctionfacility, a prevention person is based at the correctional facility, and the medical director reports monthly to the NHP. An areato be further looked at is expanding the policy to test not only on entry, but on exit.

title.narrative: Number of CSWs and MSMs reached through prevention activities.

comment.narrative: Component 1 indicator.

target.value: SW: 30,000; MSM: 19,000 (RF targets are SW: 14955; MSM: 14059)

comment.narrative: Targets have been increased as a significant amount of funds have been approved or re-programmed to further increase BCC outreachwork. The revised targets are in line with increased national targets also approved by the Global Fund. For SW, the target hasbeenincreased from 14,955 to 30,000 and for MSM the target has been increased from 14,059 to 19,000. Targets are cumulative. It isestimated that the SW population in Jamaica ranges from 7,000 – 18,000 and the MSM population is 9,000 to 27,000

Target Surpassed. Factors contributing to the targets being surpassed are the number of empowerment workshops the preventioncomponent has been organizing for CSW and MSM and that new hot spots have been identified allowing the Program to expand its reachto these areas.

title.narrative: % of young women and men aged 15 - 24 who both correctly identify ways of preventing the sexual transmission of HIV and who reject major misconceptions about HIV transmission

comment.narrative: Component 1 indicator.

Target Not Achieved. The challenge with this indicator is due to being a two-part question. Individuals have to identify notonlythe ways of preventing HIV transmission, but at the same time know the major misconceptions. The KAPB 2012 final report (June2012to be confirmed) will be able to shed light on this issue.

title.narrative: % of adults & children with HIV still alive 12 months after initiation of ART.

comment.narrative: Component 2 indicator.

Target Not Achieved. Socioeconomic factors, stigma and discrimination (real or perceived), and data capture issues arecontributing to this indicator not being achieved. Calculation of this figure is subject to deficiencies in the health informationsystem, which particularly does not allow capture of patients moving enrollment from one public treatment site to another.Consideration of deaths from AIDS reported in the public system indicates that the true 12 month mortality on treatment is above90%.

title.narrative: Number of men, women & children with advanced HIV receiving antiretroviral combination therapy according to national guidelines

comment.narrative: Component 2 indicator.

The target has been increased from 7,231 to 9,000. Following the UNAIDS Spectrum/EPP process in 2010, which revealed an estimateof 14,000 persons in need of treatment, national targets were increased to reflect placing an additional 1000 persons on treatmenteach year. This target is also supported by Global Fund.

Target Surpassed. Despite achievement of target, the NHP continues to assess how to strengthen their efforts in this area to makeinroads in reaching the estimated 50% of PLHIV unaware of their status (approx 15,800 in need), address missed opportunities fortesting (PITC), increase the uptake of testing by the MARPs, and target testing.

title.narrative: % of ANC clients that are counseled and tested for HIV (Project I phrased as #Proportion of Ante-Natal Care attendees receiving MTCT interventions#)

comment.narrative: Component 2 indicator.
Target Achieved. The target has been consistently met. Capturing private sector data remains a challenge.

title.narrative: % of HIV positive pregnant women receiving a complete course of ARV prophylaxis to reduce the risk of MTCT

comment.narrative: Component 2 indicator.

Target Surpassed. The project would like to increase from >80% to >85% given the demonstrated greater performance of the Programin this area over the past two years and because of the previous target having been consistently met since 2009. Capturing privatesector data remains a challenge.

title.narrative: Percent of reported cases of HIV-related discrimination receiving redress.

comment.narrative: Component 3 indicator.

Target Surpassed. The indicator was reworded to allow for measuring what is within the control of the NHP. Under the rewordedindicator, the target was surpassed. The decision to reword was based on the review of the indicator at MTR where the target was50% and had not been reached based on 2011 data reporting a rate of 32%.

title.narrative: Percentage of institutions/organizations reached adopting HIV/AIDS policies.

comment.narrative: Component 3 indicator.

actual.value: 217 of 206 or 105%(additional companies identified that had not been identified when baseline determined)

comment.narrative: Target Surpassed. Original target and revised target upwards have both been surpassed. The presence of an HIV/AIDS focal point,steering committees, and ongoing sensitization and training in each government ministry and the 245 peer educators trained inprivateand public sector contribute to Program’s achievements in this area.

title.narrative: Completion of computerization for Regional Labs

comment.narrative: Component 3 indicator.

MoH is seeking to establish a National HIS. This system will integrate the LIS previously established by the NHP. The NHPparticipates in the working group that is developing user requirements and specifications for this system.

title.narrative: Alternative treatment technology for biomedical waste management established in the Western Health Region.

comment.narrative: Component 4 indicator.

The MOH and Bank team decided not to pursue the establishment in the western region and decided to upgrade existing facility withadditional treatment, storage and transportation capacity. Upgrading of services is approved by the Bank if (i) additional humanresources are allocated to the facility to ensure operations at full capacity, (ii) the permit is amended with the new operations,and (iii) the financial sustainability is maintained with application of Interim fees (fees supposed to be updated with new unitdata).

title.narrative: Environmental management and monitoring plans for each plant dealing with Biomedical Waste developed and being implemented.

comment.narrative: Component 4 indicator.
Target Achieved. The existing plant will be expanded with another unit and the existing Environmental management and monitoringplan will be updated consequently.

title.narrative: Assessing the capability of the public sector to provide the population with equal access to quality health services.

comment.narrative: Component 4 indicator.

target.value: An analytic report with recommendations for improvement.

comment.narrative: Government is using IDB-grant funding of US$270,000 to undertake this assessment. Study will look at broader effects of economicimpact and provide recommendations for a basic package of health services. Study commenced the second week of May 2012 and will befinalized 6 months from this date.

title.narrative: % of infants born to HIV-infected mothers, who are HIV-infected

comment.narrative: Target Surpassed. Target has consistently been achieved and surpassed. Efforts continue to be needed in this area due to arecentdecline in the percentage of HIV positive pregnant women receiving a complete course of ARV from 86.6% in 2010 to 84.3% in2011. These preliminary figures reflect the length of time required for definitive diagnosis of vertical transmission (up to 6months). Thetrue figure for 2011 is likely to be higher than 1.4%, but lower than the target of 5%.

title.narrative: Percentage of female sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their last regular paying partners
% of people expressing accepting attitudes towards PLWHA, of all people surveyed aged 15-49

comment.narrative: Target Not Achieved. The question corresponding to this indicator asks about attitudes across different scenario. Once the finalKAPB report is available (June 2012 to be confirmed), the data can be segregated to determine if the unaccepting attitudes arefocused on one scenario or across the board. The question asks how individuals would feel towards a school teacher, shopkeeper,looking after a sick family member, encouraging family member to keep status a secret.

title.narrative: % of young people aged 15-24 reporting the use of a condom the last time they had sex with a non-regular sexual partner

comment.narrative: Target Not Achieved. One of the reasons cited as contributing to the target not being achieved is the economic situation which isa factor driving transactional sex and impacts the use of condoms in negotiating sex. According to KAPB 2012 data, 49.13% of menand 20.72% of females reported transactional sex in last 12 months (questions administered from Jan –March 2012).
